description: Squarefree numbers such that every digit as well as sum of the digits is a squarefree number.
example: a(7) = 23 is a squarefree number, 2 and 3 are squarefree numbers and the sum of the digits 5 is also a squarefree number.
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jun 16 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jun 19 2001
